title: China’s ‘Common Prosperity’ to Squeeze Cash-Strapped Local Governments
sub_head: Beijing has pledged to expand public services in education, healthcare and housing, but much of cost burden is expected to fall on heavily-indebted local governments
body:
BEIJING—Local governments in China have long been weighed down by debts. Now Chinese leader Xi Jinping’s push for “common prosperity” is heaping more pressure on them—while removing some of their most reliable sources of income.
Mr. Xi’s drive, which is aimed in part at narrowing the wealth gap in China, is rooted in an effort to address the rising costs of education, healthcare and housing—which are often referred to as the “three big mountains.”
